top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas' Gravel roads forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
50ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas. Train it until it feels boring.
At Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
When someone attacks on mixed gravel, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on mixed gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 80 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Smooth pedaling at 80 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.
Varied gradients on mixed gravel demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride Kansas demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: gravel roads. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 80 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 80 miles of mixed gravel in Lawrence, Kansas.
